## VariableMap.createVariable() method

Create a variable with a given name, optional type, and optional ID.

**Signature:**

```typescript
createVariable(name: string, opt_type?: string, opt_id?: string): IVariableModel<IVariableState>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

name


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The name of the variable. This must be unique across variables and procedures.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_type


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The type of the variable like 'int' or 'string'. Does not need to be unique. Field\_variable can filter variables based on their type. This will default to '' which is a specific type.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_id


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The unique ID of the variable. This will default to a UUID.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[IVariableModel](./blockly.ivariablemodel_interface.md)<!-- -->&lt;[IVariableState](./blockly.ivariablestate_interface.md)<!-- -->&gt;

The newly created variable.
